titleText: Microsoft's Nadella Wants to Help Coders Take a Quantum Leap

titleText: The Microsoft Graph is about to light up a new way for business users to search
mainText: In May 2017, SharePoint execs said Microsoft was working on a new search experience across Office. At Ignite this week, Microsoft officials are filling in the details about exactly what this is going to mean. At.

titleText: Microsoft makes Teams primary teamwork hub, replacing Skype for Business
mainText: Microsoft Corp’s Teams application will be replacing Skype for Business as the company’s primary teamwork software, Microsoft said on Monday, in its latest effort to defend against the threat of upstart Slack in the workplace.

titleText: Microsoft replacing Skype for Business with Teams
mainText: The move announced at Microsoft’s Ignite annual conference shows the growing importance of Teams, Microsoft’s answer to Slack. Microsoft is ending Skype’s foray into business communications, packaging its communications tools into Microsoft Teams, the company’s challenge.

titleText: Microsoft takes its first steps of its plan to migrate Skype for Business users to Teams
mainText: It's happening: Skype for Business Online is on its way to being replaced by Microsoft Teams. Microsoft accidentally leaked word of its plans to migrate its Skype for Business customers to its Teams chat-based collaboration service.

titleText: Microsoft unveils its next-generation AI developer tools
mainText: Microsoft is adding to its AI development tool stable with new Azure Machine Learning tools. Microsoft is taking the wraps off what it's calling its 'next generation of Azure Machine Learning' at its Ignite IT Pro.

titleText: Microsoft finally starts doing something with LinkedIn by integrating it into Office 365
mainText: Last year, Microsoft bought LinkedIn for $26.2 billion, but even though the acquisition has long closed, Microsoft hasn’t yet done much with all of the data it gets from the social network. At its Ignite.

titleText: Microsoft just unleashed three long-anticipated secret weapons in the cloud wars
mainText: Microsoft will unveil its latest arsenal in the cloud wars on Monday as it opens Ignite, one of the company's largest customer conferences. Microsoft is using the Orlando event to officially and formally release some much-anticipated.

titleText: Microsoft links its new Cosmos DB database to serverless technology for Azure developers

titleText: More Windows 10 S PCs, starting at $275, are on the way

titleText: Microsoft launches new healthcare division based on artificial intelligence software
mainText: Microsoft is setting up a new healthcare department at its Cambridge research facility, as part of plans to use its artificial intelligence software to enter the health market. The computer giant has created the division as.
